-------- Original Message --------
Subject: [ABUSE] Notice of copyright infringement
Date: Fri, 16 Jun 2006 08:33:48 -0600
From: Charles Cazabon
<charlesc-copyright-enforcement-theplanet.com@discworld.dyndns.org>
To: ImageShack Abuse Desk <abuse@imageshack.us>
CC: ThePlanet Abuse Desk <abuse@theplanet.com>

Greetings,

A user of the server at 67.18.240.106/img196.imageshack.us in ThePlanet
IP space is violating my copyright.  Here are the particulars:

> 1. A physical or electronic signature of a person authorized to act on

> behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed.

This message contains my electronic signature.  I am the exclusive
copyright holder of the work in question and therefore am authorized to
act in this matter.

> 2. Identification of the copyrighted work claimed to have been 
> infringed, or, if multiple copyrighted works at a single online site 
> are covered by a single notification, a representative list of such
works at that site.

The particular copyrighted work is a photograph of a pet hamster.
The original work is located on my website at the following URL:
Page: http://pyropus.ca/personal/pets/moka-latte/page-16.html
Image:
http://pyropus.ca/personal/pets/moka-latte/20030112-latte-crazy-nails1.j
pg

> 3. Identification of the material that is claimed to be infringing or 
> to be the subject of infringing activity and that is to be removed or 
> access to which is to be disabled, and information reasonably 
> sufficient to permit the service provider to locate the material.

The infringing copy of my work is here:
http://img196.imageshack.us/img196/2959/20030112lattecrazynails16aw.jpg

Interestingly, the message board post where this user used my file is
here:
http://www.detroitluv.com/index.php?topic=34324.0

In it, you can see he says:

  Totally. If I really want to use it, guess what, right click, save as,
  rehost, "fuck you".

  Exactly.

  Which brings me to the angry fucker I was going to post and now I've
saved
  and reposted.

It clearly indicates intent to commit copyright infringement; it was a
deliberate act, and not a misunderstanding.  As such, I would think it
warrants complete termination of that users' account.

> 4. Information reasonably sufficient to permit the service provider to

> contact the complaining party, such as an address, telephone number, 
> and, if available, an electronic mail address at which the complaining

> party may be contacted.

Name, address, phone number:

Charles Cazabon
101 - 116 Research Drive
Saskatoon, SK
S7N 3R3
(306) 382-4100 ext. 106

Email contact is preferred; you may reach me at this email address.

> 5. A statement that the complaining party has a good faith belief that

> use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by 
> the copyright owner, it's agent, or the law.

I have not authorized this use of my copyrighted work, and it is not
authorized by the law.  I thus have a good-faith belief that this is an
infringing copy of my copyrighted work.

> 6. A statement that the information in the notification is accurate, 
> and under penalty of perjury, that the complaining party is authorized

> to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly
infringed.

The information in this notification is accurate and made under penalty
of perjury.  I am the copyright holder of the work in question, and
therefore am authorized to act on my own behalf.

I trust this is sufficient for you to take action.  I would like the
infringing work removed immediately, and a statement that the user will
not be permitted to re-post the offending work to the server in
question.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Charles Cazabon
